titleStmt.title: The country-man's huy [sic] and cry against high heads and masked faces. Or, His sentiments of the vain apparel of the femal [sic] sex, which he told his wife, (and he might as well have told all the town hens.) To the tune of Gaberluingie man.

The country-man's huy [sic] and cry against high heads and masked faces. Or, His sentiments of the vain apparel of the femal [sic] sex, which he told his wife, (and he might as well have told all the town hens.) To the tune of Gaberluingie man.
